section.title: How to Locate Log Files in the Windows, Linux, and All Platforms Versions
section.p: To locate the Log file or Config file that uses for logging purposes, go to the Administration Page and in the General tab you can view the location of the logging files.

section.title: How to Locate the Logs of the WAR Version
section.p: By default, the WAR version of sends its logs to standard output. To configure it to send logs to a file, edit the Config file and replace the first line with:log4j.rootCategory= warn, R2Also replace the value of the log4j.appender.R2.File property with the path of the file where you want the logs to be saved.

section.title: Enabling HTTP Request Logging
section.p: To enable a detailed logging of the HTTP requests sent by , edit the Config file and add the following lines:log4j.category.org.apache.http.impl.conn=debug log4j.category.org.apache.http.impl.client=debug log4j.category.org.apache.http.client=debug log4j.category.org.apache.http.wire=debug log4j.category.org.apache.http=debug

body.note: Making changes to the Config file requires that you restart the applicationrestart the application.
